intro: Staurogyne itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia water plant, is a species of aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as lakes and ponds. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Staurogyne itatiaiae plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
